item.title: Advanced Logging in Python
item.description: Over this past weekend I was working my through Codecademy’s “Advanced Python 3” course, which has an initial module that introduces students to Python’s logging library. There was a wonderful little project—“ATM Logging”—that was quite fun to tackle, especially as it made really clear why one might want to use logging instead of filling one’s code with a bunch of print() statements. The setup was that we had a pretty simple little “ATM” program/script that would allow us to deposit and withdraw money—while providing some error messages to keep track of things throughout the whole process.
